TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The applicant is a lawyer by profession .

On DATE a pensioner , henceforth called ORG , instituted civil proceedings before ORG of Eastern GPE ( PERSON ) against ORG ) and ORG ( Socialministeriet ) , claiming compensation in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) , equal to MONEY ( ORG ) , alleging that the ORG had used a wrong yearly regulating price index concerning DATE , which had been detrimental to his retirement pension received during DATE . A successful outcome to the proceedings for ORG would have had a significant impact on other pensioners , recipients of social welfare etc . , resulting in them having claims of up to ORG MONEY ( approximately ORG MONEY ) .

The ORG were represented by the Legal Adviser to ORG ) , who is a private lawyer . When working for the ORG it is on the basis of a contract on special conditions e.g. that his fee corresponds to CARDINAL of a normal billing rate for lawyers .

On DATE , ORG ordered that ORG be represented by a lawyer and the applicant agreed to represent him . ORG ’s insurance company paid DKK CARDINAL in legal insurance coverage to the applicant . Moreover , on DATE ORG ( PERSON ) granted SN free legal aid ( fri proces ) with the consequence that all legal costs and expenses incurred before ORG were to be paid by the ORG and that it was for ORG to decide on the fee to be awarded to the applicant .

On DATE , the applicant informed ORG that at that stage he had spent TIME on the case . By decision of DATE , ORG exceptionally granted the applicant a provisional fee amounting to DKK CARDINAL plus VAT , equal to approximately ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , and informed him that the final calculation of the fee had to await the passing of the judgment in the case .
On DATE the Legal Adviser to ORG announced that he was ready for ORG to schedule the trial .

At a hearing on DATE ORG drew the applicant ’s attention to CARDINAL c of ORG ( Retsplejeloven ) , according to which an appointed lawyer was entitled to an appropriate fee , and noted that , according to established practice the calculation of the fee took the guiding rates as the starting point and further depended on the scope of the work , the nature of the case and the values involved . Moreover , ORG invited the applicant to concentrate on the crucial issues of the case .

By letter of DATE the applicant requested that the High Court grant him another provisional fee . He contended that TIME of work were still unpaid and that he had spent TIME on the case since his last request . The request was refused by ORG on DATE , noting that the decisive factor when calculating the fee was the value of the legal action , which in the present case amounted to DKK CARDINAL maximum .
On DATE , ORG again invited the applicant to concentrate on the crucial issues and asked him whether the trial could be scheduled .
On DATE ORG scheduled the trial to take place over DATE in DATE .

By letter of DATE , the applicant requested anew to be granted a provisional fee . He maintained that so far he had received remuneration for TIME of work , whereas TIME were still unpaid . Moreover , the applicant estimated that he would need TIME to finish the case , including DATE for the trial itself .

ORG refused the request on DATE and noted , among other things , that the trial had been fixed for a longer duration , which in itself could be expected to give rise to a not insignificant fee at the end of the case .

The applicant requested that the Leave - to - Appeal Board ( Procesbevillingsnævnet ) grant him leave to appeal against the decision to ORG ( Højesteret ) . In support thereof he maintained that there was a clear disproportion between the remuneration that he had received and the remuneration that the Legal Adviser to ORG had received . At the relevant time the latter had been paid DKK CARDINAL , equal to ORG CARDINAL . ORG ( Advokatsamfundet ) intervened on the applicant ’s behalf and maintained that the said disproportion was a breach of the principle of equality of arms within the meaning of LAW .

By decision of DATE the Leave - to - ORG refused to grant leave to appeal against ORG decision of DATE as it did not find that the matter raised questions of principle as required by LAW , subsection CARDINAL of ORG . The decision gave rise to attention from the media and in parliament .

On DATE again the applicant applied for a provisional fee , which was granted by ORG on DATE in the amount of DKK CARDINAL plus VAT , equal to approximately EUR CARDINAL . ORG took note of the fee that had been paid by the ORG to the Legal Adviser to ORG . At the same time it pointed out that the final determination of the fee to be paid to the applicant had to await the closing of the case before it .

By judgment of DATE , which ran to CARDINAL pages , ORG found against GPE . The latter was granted leave to appeal against the judgment to ORG , where the case is still pending . In these proceedings ORG was also granted free legal aid .

By decision of DATE ORG also determined the final fee to be paid to the applicant , who had submitted that since the lodging of the case he had spent TIME on the case . ORG awarded him a final additional fee for his work before it in the amount of DKK CARDINAL , equal to approximately ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , plus reimbursement for costs incurred in the amount of DKK MONEY .
Thus , altogether , for his work before ORG the applicant was paid DKK CARDINAL , CARDINAL ( approximately ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) .
The Legal Adviser to ORG was paid an amount of DKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL , equal to ORG MONEY , by the ORG for his work and expenses before ORG .

On ORG ’s behalf , maintaining that he had been paid too little , the applicant requested that the Leave - to - Appeal Board grant him leave to appeal to ORG against ORG decision of DATE concerning the fee .
The request was refused by ORG on DATE as it did not find that the matter raised questions of principle as required by LAW , subsection CARDINAL of ORG .

On DATE the applicant requested that the Leave - to - Appeal Board re - open the case . In support thereof , he referred inter alia to a decision of CARDINAL DATE ( published in ORG ( ORG for DATE . CARDINALH ) in which ORG had increased the fees to be awarded to CARDINAL lawyers in a concrete case . The applicant also submitted the bill of the Legal Adviser to ORG to the ORG from which it followed that the former was entitled to CARDINAL . Had the normal TIME billing rate for lawyers been applied , however , the Legal Adviser would have been entitled to MONEY CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL for his work before ORG .
Before ORG the applicant also filed an internal note from ORG specifying that when determining the fee to the applicant it had accepted that he had spent TIME on the case .
On DATE ORG refused to re - open the case .

The public legal aid in civil proceedings ( fri proces ) covers expenses of civil actions for persons whose personal income and capital income do not exceed DKK CARDINAL , or for married couples the amount of DKK CARDINAL . Applications for aid in civil actions are examined by ORG ( PERSON ) and granted in view of the expected outcome of the lawsuit . However , granted aid will be paid without regard to the actual findings of the court .
The relevant provisions of ORG ( Retsplejeloven ) read as follows :
CARDINAL . The appointed lawyer is entitled to an appropriate fee , in addition to reimbursement for expenses , including travelling costs , which have reasonably been incurred as part of his work .

CARDINAL . The court appointing a lawyer also determines the fee and the reimbursement to be paid . The determination thereof is made in an independent decision at the end of the case or the legal action .
CARDINAL . The appointed lawyer may not receive fee or reimbursement but for the amount set by the court . ...
In addition , various private insurance companies offer legal insurance coverage often as integrated in the basic family insurance .

Pursuant to LAW , subsection CARDINAL of ORG , the Leave - to - Appeal Board may grant leave to appeal to ORG against ORG decisions . Leave to appeal may be granted if the case raises questions of principle .
